titleStmt.title: F. H. Oehlmann, Edward Woodruff, and B. T. Heorton, Affidavit
CWG1836

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
JOHN A. SHANK,
ATTORNEY & COUNSELOR AT LAW,
MASONIC TEMPLE, THIRD STREET,
Cincinnati, Ohio.

REFERENCES. -- Hon. L. B. Gunckle, Dayton, Ohio; Hon S. Shellabarger, Springfield, Ohio; Judge Ranny, Columbus, Ohio; Thos. Millikin, Hamilton, O.; Judge Caldwell, Cin., O.; Henry Snow, Cin., O.; Hon. Chas A. Buckalew, Penn.

We hereby certify, that John A. Shank, an applicant for appointment as commissioner of Deeds, for the state of Kentucky is of good moral character, and that he possesses sufficient qualifications and ability to discharge the duties of said office --

F. H. Oehlmann
County Records of Ham.
Co. Ohio

Edwd Woodruff
Probate Judge
Ham Co Ohio

B. J. Horton, Clerk
Ham. Co. Com. Pleas

Ohio
Comr Deeds
John A Shank
apptd
29th Aprl 1864
